QuestionJSON.Question: Equator has been collecting data on how their Wi-Fi signal strength varies as they move around various parts of their home. Having collected substantial data, Equator decides to visualize it to observe any patterns or relationships. Equator believes that the signal strength drops substantially in the kitchen compared to other areas of the house. Which type of visual representation would best support Equator's claim?
QuestionJSON.Answer1: A scatter plot with distance from the router as the x-axis and signal strength as the y-axis
QuestionJSON.Answer2: A line graph with the time of day as the x-axis and signal strength as the y-axis
QuestionJSON.Answer3: A pie chart showing the percentage of signal strength in each room
QuestionJSON.Answer4: A bar graph with room names as the x-axis and average signal strength as the y-axis
QuestionJSON.Explanation: Since Equator wants to compare the signal strength in different areas of the house, a bar graph that shows the average signal strength for each room would be the most effective visual representation. Other graphs such as scatter plots and line graphs would not provide the comparative clarity that a bar graph would.
